page.title: 13TILHILL FORESTRY.
page.content: Tilhill is the 2nd biggest forestry group in our area. They are very similar to the E.F.G.(Economic Forestry Group) in the way that they look after the land for private owners. The Tilhill Group manage about 116 hectares in our area. Only 100 hectares of this land is used for planting (85%). Their job is to give advice to the owners and if the owners accept this the work is carried out.They plant the trees about 2 metres apart which is about 4 sq.metres to every tree. The main danger in this area is the risk of fire because of the rubbish dump close by the forest. They also have problems with beetles which live in the bark of felled trees and they attack young trees. Deer can also prove to be troublesome.
